Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2007 11:50AM asicsgirl wrote: Hi I had my free tram surgery 6.5 weeks ago. All was going well until the third week when I started to have the same problem. My stitches were not dissolving as expected and a some were spitting through the skim. One left a 2 inch whole which keeps opening - my surgeon has stitched it up twice and I think it might be coming undone again. A few days ago another huge area  (about 3 inches) completing opened up. I have also had problems with the binder I had to wear after surgery - my surgeon thinks it may have been the other cause to the scar opening. I went to another surgeon the other day just because my surgeon was not available to see about the new opening and he doesn't believe in restitching abdominal openings. Says it will just come open again and it will eventuall heal on its own. I hope this is the case as I am tired of getting stitched up because the few days after are quite painful. My surgeon says this is minor so don't worry about it but it is just frustrating. Just wanted to share my story to let you know it does happen.

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2008 08:21PM asicsgirl wrote: Hi SpunkyGirl  I haven't had any problems with LE at all so far. My surgeon who did the mastectomy told me that since I was active, I was unlikley to get LE. I continued to run during chemo and radiation and did some light weights so I am not sure if that helped me. I wouldn't worry about getting it if I were you. I did find my pec muscle gets tight quite often though but it gets better as time goes on. Keep running. I truly believe that staying active keeps me positive and will in turn keep me cancer free.
